byline.original: By RONALD KAHN; Ronald Kahn, a physicist, specializes in theories of the early universe

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A Federal judge yesterday banished a reputed organized-crime figure from much of the New York metropolitan region for five years as a condition of his probation.

headline.main: Crime Figure Given Exile, Not Prison

docs.snippet: LEAD: A Federal judge yesterday banished a reputed organized-crime figure from much of the New York metropolitan region for five years as a condition of his probation.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: MEDICAL scientists have often seen illnesses that seem at first to be isolated reponses to external shocks but later take on lives of their own. A single episode of depression, for example, can be followed by repeated attacks that come and go with increasing frequency for no apparent reason.

headline.main: Theory Explains Slow Emergence of Mental Ills

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: For more than two years, top officials debated whether giving clean needles to New York City drug addicts would do more good or harm in a city that is home to half the nation's heroin addicts and that expects to bear the worst damage from the rising AIDS epidemic.

headline.main: Weighing of 2 Perils Led to Needles-for-Addicts Plan
